summary: This document is an amended application and supporting affidavit from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking a second warrant for prospective and historical cellphone location data and pen register information for a phone believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. It corrects errors in a previous application and details the legal basis and probable cause for tracking Maxwell following her indictment on June 29, 2020, to facilitate her arrest.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: She is the attorney for the United States who submits the amended application for the warrant to track Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphone.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; the cellphone tracking is sought to locate her for arrest on charges including conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Her phone was in contact with the target cellphone in or about May 2020, as noted in the corrected affidavit.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Maxwell shares a joint bank account; his phone was in contact with the target cellphone in or about March 2020.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Her phone was in contact with the target cellphone within the last 30 days; she represents Maxwell in civil litigation.

persons.name: Katharine H. Parker
persons.context: She granted the original warrant application on June 29, 2020, and is the judge before whom the amended affidavit is sworn.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: She signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

connections.description: Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister, and their phones were in contact.
They share a joint bank account, and Maxwell's Amazon account has sent multiple packages to Borgerson.
Laura Menninger is an attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation.
The law firm Haddon, Morgan, & Foreman represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation, and its phone was in contact with the target cellphone.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant Issued for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed an arrest warrant.

events.title: Original Warrant for Cellphone Tracking Granted
events.description: Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker granted the original application for cellphone location and pen register information for the target phone.

events.title: Submission of Amended Application
events.description: The government submitted an amended application and affidavit to correct errors in the original affidavit regarding contact dates with phones of Isabel Maxwell and Scott Borgerson.

events.title: Commencement of Prospective Cellphone Tracking
events.description: The collection of prospective location data for the target cellphone began on or about this date, following the original warrant.

keyFacts: The target cellphone (978-525-8484) is subscribed in the name 'G Max' and is believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell.

The amended application corrects two errors in the original affidavit: contact with Isabel Maxwell's phone last occurred in May 2020 (not within 30 days), and contact with Scott Borgerson's phone last occurred in March 2020 (not within 30 days).
The government seeks to track the phone's location prospectively for 45 days and historically from June 1, 2020, to locate Maxwell for arrest following her indictment.

The application includes a request for a non-disclosure order to prevent the service provider (AT&T) from notifying the subscriber of the warrant for one year, to avoid flight or witness intimidation.
The document reveals Maxwell's connections through phone contacts with her sister Isabel, associate Scott Borgerson, and her attorneys Laura Menninger and the law firm Haddon, Morgan, & Foreman.
